alternatives.transcript: lately we've been hearing a lot about taxes the taxes mean different things to different people lawmakers do taxes at a broad level taxes me Revenue the millions or billions of dollars needed to keep government programs and services funded and to pay off debt but working men and women view taxes from a much more personal level

working Americans understand the contribution that tax revenues make to the quality of life in our society but we also know firsthand the effect that taxes can have on a weekly paycheck or a Shopper's pocketbook when taxes go up we feel the bite

right now the the question of whether taxes should be raised and if so how and how much is being debated at every level of government working men and women must be part of that debate some lawmakers want to increase working people's share of of the tax burden we must defend our right to pay our fair share of taxes and no more

the video you're about to see deals with the subject of tax fairness I urge you to watch it carefully and then to become involved in the debate because the kinds of taxes we are asked to pay and the share of the burden we are asked to carry are of vital importance to everyone in the Trade union movement today

hello I'm Tim white with a special report on tax fairness and what that means for workers today the roots of today's tax problems go back at least 10 years to the early 1980s and a series of tax cuts and tax breaks that benefited only the rich
I'm asking you to act on this plan first and the greater gist
along with the tax breaks came huge cutbacks in needed programs and services the result a decade of contrast marked on the One Hand by extravagance and greed

and marked on the other hand by a growing range of problems an epidemic of drug abuse a decaying infrastructure a bankrupt educational system and to cap off the decade Scandal including a savings and loan Scandal so huge that the bailout could cost every man woman and child in this country at least two thousand dollars

we just can't ignore these problems any longer but after a decade of greed giveaways and Scandal the government's broke in fact we have a budget deficit so large it's almost unimaginable higher taxes will have to be part of the solution but the question for working men and women is who pays or you know trade unionists have always been willing to pay our fair share of taxes and we know this country faces important problems that

will have to be paid for but is it fair to make working people pay more while the reagan-bush millionaires continue to benefit from tax breaks if there are going to be new taxes they've got to be fair

well to me Fair taxes means had the strongest shoulders should bear the strongest burden not the way it is today that the very rich in this country are not paying taxes and the middle income people are being soaked every day by more and more taxes one group that has led the fight for fair taxes who citizens for tax Justice we spoke with its director Bob McIntyre

but the idea of fair taxes isn't very complicated people that make a lot of money out of pay more of it in Texas than ordinary people that don't make so much but what's happened over the last decade and a half is that ordinary people's taxes have gone up by about 400 dollars a piece for the typical middle income family but the very rich have seen their taxes go down by eighty two thousand dollars apiece for the top one percent that's not fair how did this happen how did we fall into a system where working people have to pay more of their income

come in taxes then wealthy people do well what happened is in the late 70s and early 1980s there were two major tax change bills they were called tax cuts but they're only tax cuts for the very wealthy and they were gigantic for them most people saw their taxes get pushed up with inflation and with higher Social Security taxes so you had a tax shift the middle class paid more the rich paid far less and the government on net basis collected far less and revenues and that's where we are today most of us pay too much in taxes the

government runs gigantic deficits and the rich are getting a free ride one example of an unfair tax is the FICA or Social Security tax taken out of your paycheck every dollar you make up to 50 $1300 is subject to Social Security tax but if someone makes more than that the total tax B is much less another unfair tax is the consumer excise tax placed on everyday items like gasoline beer and cigarettes

these taxes take the same amount from anyone who buys the product no matter how much money he or she might make that's not fair in fact a number of Studies have found that consumer excise taxes are the most unfair type of tax for example the Congressional budget office said that an excise tax is the most regressive of all taxes and to study by citizens for tax justice found that the burdens of excise taxes as a share of income would be far higher

Iran poor and middle-income families than they would be on wealthy people what can be done to restore fairness to our tax system we asked the tax experts and labor leaders we spoke with to respond making the system Fair again is pretty straightforward we don't need to raise taxes on average people what we do need to do is get the big multinational corporations that aren't paying taxes at all in many cases to start paying we need to get the very rich to pay at a higher rate than average people pay which they don't now

we need to beef up our inheritance taxes so that when people leave these billion dollars States some of it comes back to pay for the programs that all of us need we should be telling our elected representatives that taxes ought to be fair all taxes ought to be based on income that we ought to do away with things like a flat tax or an excise tax and put it on the basis of income we need to track and police the behavior of elected officials especially those in Congress

we need to be in a position that each and every election day prior to voting we have sent them a message that says your election depends on whether or not you created a tax policy that is fair that is based on those who make the most paying the most there's no question the time has come for the labor movement to show lawmakers at the federal state and local level that we care about Fair taxes
please talk to your local leaders and find out how to get involved in the fight for tax fairness

the AFL-CIO supports a program of tax fairness for working people it's elements include first opposing new regressive taxes on Working Families labor opposes any increased Reliance on sales taxes consumer excise taxes or other taxes based on consumption second raising new Revenue by raising income tax rates for the wealthiest persons in society and for large corporations
and third closing tax loopholes that benefit corporations and the wealthy

you can speak out for tax fairness to let your elected officials know that you want tax fairness and that you support the afl-cio's plan tell them it's time America got back to a tax system based on ability to pay
